abstract: Kim Dong-chul, man claiming to be naturalized American citizen held in North Korea since October, confesses to spying on country in collusion with South Korea and begs for mercy; several Americans detained by North Korea over years have admitted to anti-state activities, only to later say confessions were coerced.
lead_paragraph: The man, Kim Dong-chul, who claims to be a naturalized American citizen, apologized for trying to steal military secrets in collusion with South Koreans.

headline.main: Man Detained in North Korea Confesses to Spying for South
headline.print_headline: Man in North Korea Says He Spied for South

snippet: The man, Kim Dong-chul, who claims to be a naturalized American citizen, apologized for trying to steal military secrets in collusion with South Koreans.
